author: m.kalinin
content: Processing `RecentBeaconBlocks` as it's spec'd atm may open a DoS vector. One may send a set of random hashes and according to the spec node has to do database lookup for each of those hashes. In a vast majority of cases random `null` lookups bypasses all caches and eventually hits disk, even bloom filters won't help much in there. A node might want to stop querying database after first non-existent entry and respond back with blocks retrieved before null-entry occurred.

author: m.kalinin
content: Also, depending on the implementation, random `null` queries may flood cache with non-existent entries.

author: djrtwo
content: That is why it says "Clients MUST support requesting blocks since the latest finalized epoch." rather than since the weak subjectivity period. This allows to manage a hot cache for the request domain and easily respond with null in the case of a miss
